alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 05 at 12:08AM CDT until July 05 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Franklin County in east central Kansas... Southeastern Douglas County in east central Kansas... * Until 1245 AM CDT. * At 1208 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles north of Linwood to 4 miles south of Eudora to 3 miles southwest of Baldwin City, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Eastern Lawrence, Baldwin City, Eudora, Wellsville and Vinland. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 194 and 198. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
